posts.content:

posts.author: DungeonMasterDave
posts.content:
For my next character, I want to focus on Cleric/Paladin as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how Cleric/Paladin works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Cleric/Paladin are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

posts.author: RogueReroll
posts.content:
Has anyone tried optimizing a build around Cleric/Paladin? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Cleric/Paladin are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Cleric/Paladin to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

posts.author: CriticalMiss
posts.content:
In our last session, we encountered a Basilisk and tried to use multiclass to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

Our table uses a house rule for multiclass where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

The best campaign moment I ever had involved creative use of multiclass to solve what seemed like an impossible puzzle.
